deck.name: M777A2 Pre-Fire Checks
deck.description: Essential pre-fire checks and procedures for the M777A2 Howitzer

cards.front: What is the first step in performing M777A2 pre-fire checks?
cards.back: Ensure the weapon is in SAFE mode and the breech is clear of all ammunition and obstructions.

cards.front: What is the maximum effective range of the M777A2 with standard ammunition?
cards.back: 22 kilometers (approximately 13.7 miles) with standard ammunition. Up to 30km with rocket-assisted projectiles.

cards.front: What caliber is the M777A2 Howitzer?
cards.back: 155mm

cards.front: What is the weight of the M777A2 Howitzer?
cards.back: Approximately 9,300 pounds (4,218 kg), making it the lightest 155mm towed howitzer in the world.

cards.front: What does DFCS stand for in the M777A2?
cards.back: Digital Fire Control System

cards.front: What is the purpose of the DFCS on the M777A2?
cards.back: The DFCS provides automated firing data computation, self-location, and pointing data to improve accuracy and reduce crew workload.

cards.front: What is the maximum rate of fire for the M777A2?
cards.back: 5 rounds per minute maximum, 2 rounds per minute sustained.

cards.front: What is the traverse range of the M777A2?
cards.back: 800 mils left or right (45 degrees each direction, 90 degrees total)

cards.front: What is the elevation range of the M777A2?
cards.back: -89 to +1,232 mils (-5 to +69.2 degrees)

cards.front: What crew size is required for the M777A2?
cards.back: Minimum crew of 5, optimal crew of 8 personnel.

cards.front: What is the purpose of the scavenge system on the M777A2?
cards.back: To remove propellant gases from the barrel after firing, preventing gas from entering the crew area when the breech opens.

cards.front: What type of breech mechanism does the M777A2 use?
cards.back: A screw-type interrupted thread breech mechanism.

cards.front: What is the primary material used in the M777A2 construction?
cards.back: Titanium and aluminum alloys, reducing weight while maintaining strength.

cards.front: How long does it take to emplace the M777A2 from travel mode?
cards.back: Approximately 3 minutes with a trained crew.

cards.front: What is the purpose of the M1156 PGK (Precision Guidance Kit)?
cards.back: A GPS-guided fuze that converts standard 155mm artillery rounds into precision munitions, reducing CEP to approximately 30 meters.

cards.front: What is the M982 Excalibur?
cards.back: A GPS-guided extended range artillery projectile with a CEP of less than 2 meters, capable of ranges up to 40km.

cards.front: What does CEP stand for in artillery terms?
cards.back: Circular Error Probable - the radius of a circle within which 50% of rounds will land.

cards.front: What is the purpose of the panoramic telescope (PANTEL) on the M777A2?
cards.back: To lay the howitzer for direction (azimuth) using aiming points and to provide fire direction center data.

cards.front: What immediate action should be taken in case of a misfire?
cards.back: Wait 30 seconds (hangfire interval), then announce 'MISFIRE' and follow unit SOP for misfire procedures.

cards.front: What is the hangfire interval for artillery?
cards.back: 30 seconds - the minimum time to wait before opening the breech after a misfire to allow for a potential hangfire.
